articles.title: 'Stranger Things' split season's success may have saved Netflix, so expect to see it a lot more
articles.content: A change in programming for one of Netflix's most popular shows, "Stranger Things," may have saved the reeling streaming giant from an expected decline in subscribers by forcing them to stick around for the second half of the season.

articles.title: Why Apple's BNPL efforts could mark a 'tipping point' in lending
articles.content: Apple Inc.'s expansion into buy-now pay-later financing could be just the beginning of an attempt to shake up the traditional payments system.

articles.title: Down 26%, Is the Nasdaq Ready to Recover in the Last Half of 2022?
articles.content: While there is ample macroeconomic uncertainty keeping the Nasdaq down, the market is a forward-looking machine. The slightest easy in conditions could turn things around.

articles.title: Here's how far house prices are set to fall as rates go up, according to this forecasting firm
articles.content: This is not a 2008 reboot, says Capital Economcs' Neil Shearing.

articles.title: 2 Reddit Stocks to Buy and Hold for Years
articles.content: Reddit's WalStreetBets investors still love Apple and AMD.
